history.content:
Dear Students,
 
We are currently exploring new ways to get this information to you more efficiently.  I am posting here to see if that is a better medium than email. Let me know your thoughts!
 
September 13th was International Programmers Day! I hope you all celebrated.
​

Upcoming Registration Deadlines

The deadline to add classes without a fee was September 8, 2017 at 11:59pm PST. You will be charged a $5 fee for each class added after this date.

 

Starting September 9, 2017, if you are on the waitlist for a class you no longer intend to enroll, dropping your waitlisted class will result in a late drop fee.

 

The deadline to add and/or drop a class via CalCentral is September 22 at 11:59pm PST.

Undergraduate Panel - How to get Involved in Research

NSF Application Workshop

Join us Friday, September 22 from 3:00 - 4:00 pm in the HP Auditorium (306 Soda) for the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program (NSF GRFP) Applicant Workshop.  US Citizens and Permanent Residents in their senior year of college or first year of graduate school should not miss this opportunity. Come hear about the application process and campus resources to help you prepare your application from the Berkeley NSF Coordinator, as well as advice from current EECS grad students supported by the award.  


If you cannot make the department workshop the campus also holds a general NSF GRFP Application info session on Wednesday, September 20 from 10:00 AM – 11:30 PM in 309 Sproul Hall.


NSF website: https://www.fastlane.nsf.gov/grfp/

Intersect Conference

We are excited to announce that registration is now live for the 3rd annual Intersect Conference on Thursday, October 5, 2017 from 11:00AM-6:00PM at UC Berkeley's Pauley Ballroom. It is open to all UC Berkeley students, alumni, staff, faculty and administration.


This year's theme focuses on the concept of "unlearning." Participants will recognize and challenge current systems of thought, explore how power, privilege, and intersectional identities shape their relationships, and activate their reflections into daily acts of transformation. ​​Registration for the conference is now open. Registration will close on Friday September 29, 2017.


Note: Early registration is advised as this event historically fills up very quickly. Registration will remain open on a first come, first served basis until filled. Some sessions will be repeated throughout the day to ensure maximum participation. Descriptions of the breakout sessions will be updated to the Intersect website shortly.


Should you have any questions, email intersect@berkeley.edu. Please share this email widely. We look forward to seeing you there!

Research Assistantship - Nuclear Data

See this attachment for more information.

Be A Scientist: Inspire 7th graders to discover their inner scientist!

www.crscience.org/volunteers/BeAScientist

We invite UC Berkeley graduate students, post-docs, and motivated 3rd/4th year undergrads to take part in Be A Scientist, an exciting science outreach program in Berkeley middle schools!

 

The upcoming semester is as follows:

  • Session 1 Fall 2017 will take place at Willard Middle School, September 21st - October 27th.

  • Session 2 Fall 2017 will take place at King Middle School, October 5th - December 2nd, with a two week gap (Nov. 3rd/10th) and a 1 week gap for Thanksgiving (Nov. 23rd).

As a volunteer scientist mentor, you will guide 7th graders through the process of designing and conducting their own scientific investigations in class over a 6-week period. This is a wonderful opportunity for you to serve as a STEM role model while developing your communication skills and gaining hands-on experience in important science outreach.

Details:

  • Mentors must commit to one mandatory 2-hr Training Session: On-campus trainings are offered in the two-weeks before the start of each session. Training dates/times/locations TBA

  • Commit to attend one school lab period each week for the 6-week program (schedule program dates here and attached flyer).

  • Guide 4-6 student mentees through the process of developing a testable question, designing an appropriate experiment, and gathering and analyzing data. Each student in your group will have the opportunity to choose an independent scientific question based on their own interests.

 

Please carefully read over the details provided in the attached flyer and on our website. Sign up as a mentor to make an impact on future scientists, engineers, and critical thinkers!

To learn more, visit: www.crscience.org/volunteers/BeAScientist

Questions? Contact Darlene at BASprogram@crscience.org

VOLUNTEER IN PERÚ THIS WINTER 2017!

IChange Perú is looking for volunteers interested in Health, Social Work, Education, Animal Health and more!


Impact the underserved communities of Perú.  

Learn about the culture and gain hands-on experience.

Explore one of the world's most diverse countries and it's spectacular beauty.


Application Deadline: October 6, 2017

http://ichangeperu.org/apply/


See this flyer for more information.

High School Engineering Program

Saturdays September 16 - November 18, 10 AM - 1 PM


Sign up to be a part of the High School Engineering Program! This program, hosted by the Society of Women Engineers (SWE), is a 10 week program for high school girls to be introduced to engineering. We need volunteers as mentors, curriculum developers, and creative designers. As a part of the program you will have the opportunity to work closely with highly motivated high school girls and share your experiences and knowledge in engineering, and maybe learn more about the different fields of engineering yourself! Note: you do not need to identify as a female to volunteer.


If you are interested, let us know by filling out this form! https://goo.gl/forms/VU4qIuRW6Yk7EVp23


If you have any questions, please email swe.highschool.outreach@gmail.com.

Box Diversity Scholarship

Box is excited to announce that the annual Box Diversity Scholarship is back and accepting applications! Here at Box, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive company, and leading our industry to do the same. As part of those efforts, we've created the Box Diversity Scholarship to give students from historically underrepresented groups that have a passion for technology a chance at a $20,000 grand prize scholarship (and $4000 runner up scholarships!). We want to ensure that perspectives from every group are included in the future of tech, and we want you to be a part of it too!


Please inform your department students, fellow club members, family, friends (everyone that's a current undergraduate student!) that applications are now open and due by Oct 2, 2017. For more details, please see our website. For any questions, please send a note to scholarship@box.com.

Student Leadership Opportunities with TGIF

The Green Initiative Fund (TGIF) is seeking to fill the Undergraduate Student At-Large Representative and Environmental Justice Student At-Large Representative positions on the TGIF Committee. As a student representative, the role is to help shape the direction of Cal’s sustainability efforts and decide how student fees are allocated towards sustainability projects on campus. The Undergraduate Student At-Large Representative is open to undergraduate students, while the Environmental Justice Student At-Large Representative is open to both undergraduate and graduate students at UC Berkeley.Both are student volunteer leadership positions.


The TGIF Committee meets once monthly from September-May, with the exception of meeting twice in April to select awardees for our larger spring grants.


The duties of the voting committee members are to:


1. Attend monthly committee meetings (must have availability to meet during the 9am-5pm/M-F time frame)

2. Select which projects receive funding during grant review

3. Vote on issues which require committee approval, such as project adjustments

4. Provide feedback to and help support all grantees (as needed)


The time commitment is usually less than 5 hours a month during the non-grant months (mostly just the hour-long meeting and answering any emails I might send) and 5-10 hours during the grant period months (October, November, January, February, and April)."


Applications can be found on our website (here) and are due via email to tgif_info@berkeley.edu by September 18th, 2017 at 5PM.


For more information about TGIF and the Committee please refer to our website at tgif.berkeley.edu.


Please contact Brian Gialketsis (Interim TGIF Coordinator) regarding interest and questions at bgialketsis@berkeley.edu or tgif_info@berkeley.edu.

Women in Engineering Study.com Scholarship

Study.com is excited to share a new scholarship we are offering to female students pursuing an undergraduate degree in engineering. Study.com wants to assist in furthering the educational opportunities for women in engineering-related fields of study. The Women in Engineering Study.com Scholarship gives one lucky student $500 to help with their tuition.


Applying for the Scholarship:

Students must apply by April 1, 2018, which gives them plenty of time to submit the quick and easy application. They will choose one winner based on their free response submissions.

To submit their application, students should visit this page: http://study.com/pages/Women_in_Engineering_Scholarship.html


Eligibility Requirements:

To participate in the scholarship contest, applicants must meet the following criteria:

  • Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent U.S. Resident

  • Must be an enrolled (or accepted) female student in an accredited college or university

  • Must be pursuing an undergraduate degree with an engineering emphasis

Box Diversity Scholarship

Box is excited to announce that the annual Box Diversity Scholarship is back and accepting applications! Here at Box, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive company, and leading our industry to do the same. As part of those efforts, we've created the Box Diversity Scholarship to give students from historically underrepresented groups that have a passion for technology a chance at a $20,000 grand prize scholarship (and $4000 runner up scholarships!). We want to ensure that perspectives from every group are included in the future of tech, and we want you to be a part of it too!

Student Leadership Opportunities with TGIF

The Green Initiative Fund (TGIF) is seeking to fill the Undergraduate Student At-Large Representative and Environmental Justice Student At-Large Representative positions on the TGIF Committee. As a student representative, the role is to help shape the direction of Cal’s sustainability efforts and decide how student fees are allocated towards sustainability projects on campus. The Undergraduate Student At-Large Representative is open to undergraduate students, while the Environmental Justice Student At-Large Representative is open to both undergraduate and graduate students at UC Berkeley.Both are student volunteer leadership positions.


The TGIF Committee meets once monthly from September-May, with the exception of meeting twice in April to select awardees for our larger spring grants.


The duties of the voting committee members are to:


1. Attend monthly committee meetings (must have availability to meet during the 9am-5pm/M-F time frame)

2. Select which projects receive funding during grant review

3. Vote on issues which require committee approval, such as project adjustments

4. Provide feedback to and help support all grantees (as needed)


The time commitment is usually less than 5 hours a month during the non-grant months (mostly just the hour-long meeting and answering any emails I might send) and 5-10 hours during the grant period months (October, November, January, February, and April)."


Applications can be found on our website (here) and are due via email to tgif_info@berkeley.edu by September 18th, 2017 at 5PM.


For more information about TGIF and the Committee please refer to our website at tgif.berkeley.edu.


Please contact Brian Gialketsis (Interim TGIF Coordinator) regarding interest and questions at bgialketsis@berkeley.edu or tgif_info@berkeley.edu.

Women in Engineering Study.com Scholarship

Study.com is excited to share a new scholarship we are offering to female students pursuing an undergraduate degree in engineering. Study.com wants to assist in furthering the educational opportunities for women in engineering-related fields of study. The Women in Engineering Study.com Scholarship gives one lucky student $500 to help with their tuition.


Applying for the Scholarship:

Students must apply by April 1, 2018, which gives them plenty of time to submit the quick and easy application. They will choose one winner based on their free response submissions.

To submit their application, students should visit this page: http://study.com/pages/Women_in_Engineering_Scholarship.html


Eligibility Requirements:

To participate in the scholarship contest, applicants must meet the following criteria:

  • Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent U.S. Resident

  • Must be an enrolled (or accepted) female student in an accredited college or university

  • Must be pursuing an undergraduate degree with an engineering emphasis

September 13th was International Programmers Day! I hope you all celebrated.

Upcoming Registration Deadlines

The deadline to add classes without a fee was September 8, 2017 at 11:59pm PST. You will be charged a $5 fee for each class added after this date.

 

Starting September 9, 2017, if you are on the waitlist for a class you no longer intend to enroll, dropping your waitlisted class will result in a late drop fee.

 

The deadline to add and/or drop a class via CalCentral is September 22 at 11:59pm PST.

Undergraduate Panel - How to get Involved in Research

NSF Application Workshop

Join us Friday, September 22 from 3:00 - 4:00 pm in the HP Auditorium (306 Soda) for the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program (NSF GRFP) Applicant Workshop.  US Citizens and Permanent Residents in their senior year of college or first year of graduate school should not miss this opportunity. Come hear about the application process and campus resources to help you prepare your application from the Berkeley NSF Coordinator, as well as advice from current EECS grad students supported by the award.  


If you cannot make the department workshop the campus also holds a general NSF GRFP Application info session on Wednesday, September 20 from 10:00 AM – 11:30 PM in 309 Sproul Hall.


NSF website: https://www.fastlane.nsf.gov/grfp/

Intersect Conference

We are excited to announce that registration is now live for the 3rd annual Intersect Conference on Thursday, October 5, 2017 from 11:00AM-6:00PM at UC Berkeley's Pauley Ballroom. It is open to all UC Berkeley students, alumni, staff, faculty and administration.


This year's theme focuses on the concept of "unlearning." Participants will recognize and challenge current systems of thought, explore how power, privilege, and intersectional identities shape their relationships, and activate their reflections into daily acts of transformation. ​​Registration for the conference is now open. Registration will close on Friday September 29, 2017.


Note: Early registration is advised as this event historically fills up very quickly. Registration will remain open on a first come, first served basis until filled. Some sessions will be repeated throughout the day to ensure maximum participation. Descriptions of the breakout sessions will be updated to the Intersect website shortly.


Should you have any questions, email intersect@berkeley.edu. Please share this email widely. We look forward to seeing you there!
